there is no way for me to see if there is even anyone else on the site

Overall what is here works solidly but there is not enough. I understand that you probably intend to add more features as time goes on but right now other than a clean design scheme(which I do like) and a task adder, there is not much to see.

So it seems pretty feature light right now but I really like the way everything looks thus far. I tested the time approximation and was pretty impressed when it correctly put the date for 7 months from now.
@keller - You can have "important" as part of the event and it will mark it as important or you can edit the event and mark it as important using the checkbox.

@keller - I think "40 years" task should display on the Future tab - other thing is that no one will be there on the site, you dont follow people in Socl. You can share your events on twitter, FB and checkin to Foursquare on the event time - thanks for the review...:)

After entering new credentials (signing up) you come back to startpage. You need a second to realize there is a text added with instructions to check your mailbox.
@evolutiongenx - How can I use socl.in domain (n00b question) - I am working on fixing the spam thingy
your confirmation email goes in spam!
@evolutiongenx - thx a ton.

you just have to add @ A Record in your DNS to point to your server ip, and add CNAME for www to point to @ A Record (for godaddy) You probably also need to add entry in your web server configuration file to tell which application should serve requests coming to socl.in just like you'd have done for www.socl.in
@evolutiongenx - email going to spam and socl.in is fixed
what was the exact reason for going it to spam?

I know this is probably not necessary until later, but if you want a better page rank you will want to do a 301 redirect from your www to just the domain (http://www.socl.in forces person to http://socl.in). You don't want search engines to treat them as separate domains and give separate pagerank for each.

RewriteEngine on
RewriteCond %{HTTP_HOST} ^www\.socl\.in$ [NC]
RewriteRule ^(.*)$ http://socl.in/$1 [R=301,L]
Add the following to your .htaccess in the root of your site if you want
Oh, and heads up, gmail marked your conf. email as spam for me too. Just now. Might be because it is coming from admin. I know our spam filters are sensitive to that.

@ved_antani just a few statistics for you; of 1,261 emails sent 65 bounced and only 1 had a spam complaint. Postmark provider really good analytics (sexy as well) for tracking how well your emails are getting through.

Hey @ved_antani the app looks great. Looks like your spam issue was fixed as well as I got my confirmation pretty quickly. Just a tip, while many people here would be able to find their way around the app, maybe its too plain? Some guidance/instructional text may help to drive adoption across the board when you're ready.
@AroonUp - Completely agreed. I am working on getting a video on the signup page. Thanks a ton for reviewing the app...the video will be up pretty soon.
Not a fan of the name, it doesn't tell me anything about it.
Isn't google calendar a social calendar?

@jonmarkgo - um ... no. Socl integrates with twitter, facebook and foursqure (more to come) - if google calendar does that, I am not sure. Also, I want to eliminate the need of us tweeting "I am doing xyz at abc now"...most of the tweets, facebook updates are of this nature. Socl tries to combine the todo+calendar with your social networks.
@AndrewBrackin - :) suggest a better one. What I intended was "Social+Calendar" = So+cl
Good answer :)

@ved_antani If you'd like feedback from industry professionals, early adopters, and other founders, then I'd suggest submitting it to http://startupli.st which will get you access to http://betacandy.com, the early adopter marketplace where they vote and discuss startups.
@nickfrost - Thanks Nick, will try.
@ved_antani oh I get it, I take it back then.

@ved_antani I'm not a huge fan of the logo - I get why it's like that and it's clever, but somehow it's jarring for me. Another note on the visual side, the confirmation email is strange with that dark background when your site's main background is white. Why not go with the same color scheme and a slightly smaller header section like on the main site. I like the simplicity of adding events. It'd be nice if the action icons on each event were a lot bigger because right now they're too small and too close together for me. IMO, there's too many priority colors that are very similar. Why not go with a smaller number of more distinct colors? Finally, the important sorting doesn't work for me. I have several events prioritized at different levels, yet they don't show up. Just my 2 cents.

I'd also really appreciate it if you'd give me some feedback on my own project that I just released yesterday: www.fightinertia.com - the convore group is here https://convore.com/hacker-news/fight-inertia/
Hmm, was there feedback when I filled out the sign-up form to tell me to check my email, and I missed it?
Maybe some sort of hint text in those boxes.  Or something, I was at a loss as to what to enter.
@PistolPeteX8 - Brilliant, I was thinking on the same exact lines after talking to several other people. I will change these stuff - let me review your app....

@PistolPeteX8 - Again our views on logos are very different. I dont like the glowing background on the logo. I would go with a more subtle color and text font on the logo. Also, a bit more text on how the idea will be implemented is something I would need before I submit my idea.
